sub_title: Senior Servicedesk at Operator Group Delft
summary: Experienced Technician with a demonstrated history of working in the motion pictures and film industry. Skilled in English, Discourse Analysis, Projection, Linux, and Social Media. Strong engineering professional with a Bachelor of Arts (BA) focused in Language and Culture Studies from Universiteit Utrecht.

contributors.headline: Senior Servicedesk at Operator Group Delft

profile_positions.description: For Operator Group Delft, I'm currently working as a senior Servicedesk employee. I am responsible for managing incidents and changes, troubleshooting Office IT issues, knowledge management and offering support for our customer Port of Rotterdam.
profile_positions.title: Senior Servicedesk

profile_positions.description: For Opgedoekt, a roaming secret cinema initiative, I am responsible for the screening of video materials. It entails the collection, checks, tests and conversion of video files so we can screen in the best possible way, even though we're not formally a cinema and screen on a different location every time. This has been a great learning experience and benefits my other work as well.
profile_positions.title: Technical Producer

profile_positions.description:
At Gofilex, I was responsible for outbound deliveries of digital cinema content to theaters in the Benelux. Gofilex handles e-deliveries to venues in, amongst others, the Benelux, Germany, Switzerland and the Nordic countries. Our customers ranged from small content owners who operate nationally to big studios like Disney, Warner, Fox, Universal and Paramount.

My work included the download, inspection, archiving and delivery of DCP's and other content. For these tasks, we used different systems, server set ups and applications. For these, I handled some (remote) maintenance.

To ensure timely delivery, we continually improved our methods and systems and I was involved in researching them and providing feedback to our IT department. Additionally, I was one of the people responsible for the functional management of the Gofilex Portal, always working with the developers and the business to improve the Portal and keep it running.

Additionally, I was responsible for the support we did for live events organised through the Gofilex network, as well as providing participating theaters with the information they needed. As such, I reached out to broadcasters and other live content owners who wanted their live content streamed to cinemas.

Moreover, we helped venues when they experienced problems with the playout of the content, even when the content had been delivered in order. As such, my previous experience screening content in an arthouse cinema and print traffic at film festivals proved very useful, while also learning about special formats and the quirks they have.
profile_positions.title: Digital Film Logistics

profile_positions.description:
As part of a team of three technicians my role was to guard the quality of the film programme, both regular and special screenings. In addition, I provided technical guidance to the Events & Bookings department, as well as third parties looking to organise at the Louis Hartlooper Complex. Finally, I was a technical coordinator and producer for the film festivals organised at the venue.

As we made the leap to digital cinema, it became clear that we could benefit from general IT solutions in our processes. I helped guide that transition and took the lead in reorganising our processes. As such, my focus expanded to the digital systems available at our venue. As a result, I've become more involved with general IT, providing the company with advice and solutions to standardize our processes.

My responsibilities are:

- Technical make up & automation of the film programme.
- Technical coordination & production of events & film festivals.
- Screening of film, video & DCP content.
- Light maintenance of 35mm systems.
- Light maintenance & set up of digital cinema systems.
- Maintenance of digital signage & music systems.
- System administration & light maintenance of general IT systems.
profile_positions.title: Technician

profile_positions.description:
At the Louis Hartlooper Complex, an arthouse cinema, I learned mostly about the technical side of events and festivals. Handling video, audio and some lighting became new skills. In addition, I guided the administrative/organisational part of being a projectionist. I proposed instructions and guidelines to improve the quality and efficiency of our work. Most of these are still in place now, even as we transitioned to digital cinema.

In my final year as a projectionist, I learned about digital cinema and the supporting infrastructure and practices. I sat in a project group guiding the transition to digital and provided technical know-how and advice to the group as well as fellow projectionists, both at Louis Hartlooper and our other venue, Springhaver Theatre.

My responsibilities:

- Screening of films in a four-screen cinema.
- Building and take down of film prints.
- Setting up of various events and one-off screenings, both 35mm and video.
- Light maintenance of 35mm systems.
- Some technical production and coordination for festivals
profile_positions.title: Projectionist

profile_positions.description: For the Holland Animation Film Festival I coordinated film traffic for some 440 prints and any alternative content. Gofilex, a digital cinema logistics company, converted some 230 video files to DCP. I provided them with the right content and information to do so. Before and during the festival I made sure the right prints were in the right place and the projectionists knew what to screen. As well, I planned the technical side of screenings, specials and the video library during the festival. Finally, I was present when building and breaking special events during the festival.
profile_positions.title: Film Traffic Coordinator & Technical producer

profile_positions.description: KLIK! Amsterdam Animation Festival is a small film festival organised every year at EYE, the Dutch Film Institute.
profile_positions.title: Freelance Projectionist

profile_positions.description:
For FilmTechniek I do freelance work, mostly film festivals nowadays, but from 2004 to 2006 every other week at Theatre Het Kruispunt in Barendrecht, as well as some outdoor venues across the country. In that period I learned to build an outdoor setup with screen, projector and speakers.

My responsibilities:

- One-off screenings of films.
- Building & take down of film prints.
- Setting & lining up of film projectors.
- Building and setting up of film screens.
- Setting up of speakers and audio systems.
profile_positions.title: Freelance Projectionist & Film Inspection

profile_positions.description: The Impakt Festival focuses on media culture and audiovisual arts in a multidisciplinary context.
profile_positions.title: Volunteer Projectionist

profile_positions.description: The Holland Animation Film Festival is a yearly festival in Utrecht.
profile_positions.title: Freelance Projectionist

company.name: Latin American Film Festival the Netherlands

profile_positions.company: Latin American Film Festival the Netherlands
profile_positions.description: For the Latin American Film Festival I coordinated the film traffic of some sixty film and video prints. I contacted various distributors, film makers and production houses to make sure the prints arrived in time for the festival. I provided the projectionists of the festival venue with the right information to build and screen prints in a timely manner. Finally, I sent all prints on to next venues or back to makers or production houses.
profile_positions.title: Film Traffic Coordinator
